(1 comment)

I am having trouble following all this code. 
Please add comments instead of writing code. I added more comments to the code, I hope that helps.
I like the way the code is now. With the comments it should be more clear.
Refactored.

This lambda is:

A. Too complex (violates the coding rules)
B. Multi depth (there's a lambda within a lambda)

Neither of these is acceptable practice.  Please fix it.
This is old code, not related to this commit. Only change is adding if condition. It should be in a separate commit.
I understand, but I like the way current code. With comments it should be more clear.

The comment may not be needed if the code itself is clear enough, and thus it would be preferred to more clear code structure.

Anyway, it is about the coding style and convention, and thus I'm okay if the others also agree.
Previous commit and in this commit refactored the code.
Done
Done
Done
In the case of getSubTree, if we are unable to find a valid PCIe Device path, we should consider it as a failure and handle it accordingly.
Would this need to be `return`?
I will fix it, but it is worth noting that after breaking out of the loop, the function will return.
Done
It is because of 2 for-loops. The 'break' in an inner loop does not break the outer loop.
Would this need to be `return`?
Done
change afterGetValidPCieDevicePath to afterGetValidPCIeDevicePath, same with afterGetValidPCieSlotPath
